intro: Chrysochosma weatherbiana, commonly known as the weatherbiana sunburst, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant has a compact, low-growing habit with succulent leaves that store water, adapting to its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
